title: Video: Bullets rain on Indian-origin bizman in Canada; Bishnoi gang claims responsibility
content: A shocking video captured the targeted assassination of 68-year-old Indian-origin businessman Darshan Singh Sahsi in Abbotsford, Canada.  Sahsi was shot dead in his car outside his home.  A close aide of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi claimed responsibility, alleging Sahsi refused to pay extortion money. This incident follows the Canadian government's designation of the Bishnoi syndicate as a terrorist entity.

title: 'Please take me back to jail': Gangster who fled India on 'dunki' route begs to return
content: A Gurgaon gangster, Sunil Sardhania, who fled to the US on parole last year, has returned to India after a harrowing experience on the illegal 'dunki' route. Kidnapped twice in Colombia due to payment issues, he preferred prison over the treacherous journey. Sardhania was apprehended at Delhi's IGI Airport upon his arrival.

title: Nvidia CEO complaints: China shuts us out of ecosystem; urges US to ease restrictions
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the Trump administration to reconsider AI export restrictions, warning that China's exclusion of Nvidia from its developer ecosystem hinders U.S. competitiveness. Despite China's blockade, Nvidia secured significant U.S. Department of Energy contracts, with Huang crediting Trump's "America First" policies for revitalizing U.S. manufacturing.

title: How a freezer experiment in 1946 led to mankind’s first attempt to make artificial rain
content: Delhi has revived artificial rainmaking after over 50 years, conducting a cloud-seeding trial to combat severe winter smog. A Cessna aircraft released flares over the capital, marking the third such experiment since Independence. This initiative, a collaboration with IIT Kanpur, aims to leverage technology against the city's persistent air pollution crisis.

title: NITI Aayog report: Service sector surges; jobs trail growth
content: India's booming services sector, contributing over half of national output, faces a reality check. Despite job growth, employment remains largely informal and low-paying, creating a paradox of strong output without quality jobs. Regional and gender disparities are stark, with a growing mismatch between education and job quality, demanding targeted policies for inclusive growth.

title: Rohit Sharma creates history: Becomes top-ranked ODI batter - joins elite list of Indians
content: Rohit Sharma has etched his name in history, becoming the oldest Indian to reach the No. 1 ICC ODI batting ranking at 38. His stellar performances against Australia propelled him to the top spot for the first time. This remarkable feat places him alongside cricketing legends like Tendulkar and Kohli, marking a significant moment for Indian cricket.

title: ‘You’ll burn this billion’: Gates warned Nadella on OpenAI bet; Microsoft pressed on
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella revealed Bill Gates initially cautioned against investing in OpenAI, fearing the $1 billion initial investment would be lost. Despite the risk, Microsoft proceeded, now having funded OpenAI with over $13 billion.  This investment has been pivotal, especially following the success of ChatGPT and a recent restructuring of OpenAI into a public benefit corporation.

title: 8th Pay Commission: How much salary hike should central govt staff expect?
content: 8th Pay Commission salary hike news: Central government employees and pensioners have reason to cheer as the Cabinet approves the terms of reference for the 8th Pay Commission. New salary and pension levels are expected to be effective from January 1, 2026. The commission will assess pay structures and post-retirement benefits, with its report due in 12-18 months.

title: Bengaluru man kills lover’s 7-year-old daughter for disturbing privacy
content: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering his girlfriend's seven-year-old daughter. The accused reportedly killed the child, a class 2 student, because she was a "disturbance" to his private time with her mother. He confessed to repeatedly slamming the child's head on the floor and smothering her.

title: 'Very aggressive': When Yuvi revealed reason for poor relationship with father
content: Yuvraj Singh's personal life reveals a challenging upbringing, including his decision to encourage his parents' separation due to his father's intense expectations.  He credits his mother's sacrifices for his upbringing.  Despite a strained relationship with his father, Yograj Singh, Yuvraj remains a beloved figure, admired for his cricketing prowess and resilience.

title: ‘Tough timing’: GM axes 200 salaried staff; layoffs hit days after profit surge
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Gujarat tourists nabbed in traffic jam after skipping Rs 10,900 bill at Mount Abu hotel
content: Five tourists from Gujarat attempted to evade a Rs 10,900 restaurant bill in Rajasthan by feigning restroom breaks and fleeing. Their escape was thwarted when their vehicle got stuck in traffic near the Gujarat border, leading to their apprehension and the eventual online settlement of the bill.

title: No artificial rain after cloud seeding: Why Delhi’s Rs 3.2 crore experiment fell flat
content: Delhi's attempt at tackling air pollution through cloud seeding has sparked criticism from environmental specialists who view this strategy as nothing more than a costly band-aid.

title: Indian-origin businessman killed in Canada: Bishnoi group claims responsibilty
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate has claimed responsibility for the targeted killing of an Indian-origin businessman, Darshan Singh Sahsi, in Canada. The gang alleges the murder stemmed from Sahsi's refusal to pay an extortion demand. This incident follows Canada's recent designation of the Bishnoi syndicate as a terrorist entity, a move the gang appears to have defied with further shootings.

title: India-US trade deal: Trump says going to have a deal with India
content: US President Donald Trump claimed he averted a war between India and Pakistan by threatening hefty tariffs, suggesting a trade deal with India is imminent. He stated his intervention, coupled with a refusal to proceed with trade, prompted de-escalation.

title: Gold price today: What is the gold rate in your city? Check cost of 24K, 22K gold
content: Gold prices saw a dip on Wednesday, influenced by global trends and investor caution ahead of the US Federal Reserve's policy announcement. Both Indian and international markets registered declines, marking the fourth consecutive day of losses for the yellow metal. This cautious sentiment is driven by anticipation of potential interest rate adjustments.

title: BJP vs AAP: Political row erupts over cloud seeding trial; Delhi govt accused of 'fraud'
content: Delhi's ambitious cloud seeding experiment to combat pollution has sparked a political storm. The Aam Aadmi Party accused the BJP-led government of fraud, claiming no rainfall occurred despite the costly trials. Officials defended the initiative, highlighting its potential to induce rain even at low humidity, a claim AAP dismissed as a waste of public funds.

title: 80-hour week at IISc? New attendance rule; students protest
content: A fierce debate has erupted at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, after its Department of Electronic Systems Engineering introduced a strict attendance and parking policy. According to media speculations, the rules mandate up to 80-hour workweeks for senior PhD scholars. While the department cites “discipline,” students call it “oppressive,” sparking a national conversation on India’s glorification of overwork.

title: ‘Gen Z doesn't do filters': Gurgaon CEO reacts to employee's break-up leave application
content: A Gurgaon CEO's viral post highlights a Gen Z employee's candid leave request for a breakup recovery. Jasveer Singh of Knot Dating instantly approved the request, praising the employee's unfiltered honesty. This incident sparked online discussion, with many commending the supportive workplace culture shift towards open conversations about mental well-being and emotional health.

title: '50x stronger response': Pak warns Afghan; accuses it of acting as India’s puppet
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister warned Afghanistan of a "50 times stronger" response if attacks on Islamabad continue, accusing Kabul of being an "Indian puppet." These remarks followed the dramatic collapse of peace talks in Istanbul, with Pakistan claiming India is using Afghanistan for a low-intensity war. Kabul has previously rejected such accusations as unfounded.

title: Gold prices in free fall! Drop almost 10% from peak; what should investors do?
content: Gold prices have plummeted over Rs 12,000 from their peak, driven by easing US-China trade tensions. Analysts suggest continued volatility, with key support levels holding, presenting potential opportunities for long-term investors.

title: Paws and applause! Dog patiently watches as Tamil Nadu police rescues its puppy from roadside pit; video wins internet
content: A Tamil Nadu police officer’s heartwarming rescue of a trapped puppy from a roadside pit melted hearts online. Officer Vinoth and his team used teamwork and quick thinking to save the trembling pup as its anxious mother watched. The grateful puppy’s tiny gesture of thanks turned the viral video into a powerful symbol of compassion and hope.

title: Meet the doctors who have led Shreyas Iyer's recovery after nasty fall in Sydney
content: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has been moved out of the ICU in Sydney and is in stable condition after suffering a ruptured spleen and rib cage injury. The BCCI confirmed his improvement following prompt medical attention and ongoing observation by specialists. Iyer is now on the road to recovery after the unfortunate incident.

title: Massive white airship spotted over San Francisco sky stuns residents; video goes viral
content: A colossal white airship, Pathfinder 1, recently soared over San Francisco, sparking global intrigue. Developed by Sergey Brin-backed LTA Research, this zero-emission marvel utilizes helium and electric propulsion.  It represents a significant advancement in sustainable aviation, aiming to revolutionize cargo and aid delivery to remote areas, heralding a new era for lighter-than-air transport.

title: Khalistani group vows shut down of Diljit's Australia concert over touching Big B's feet
content: Pro-Khalistan group Sikhs For Justice (SFJ) plans to disrupt Diljit Dosanjh's Australian concert on November 1, Sikh Genocide Remembrance Day. SFJ accuses Dosanjh of insulting 1984 genocide victims by touching the feet of Amitabh Bachchan, whom they allege incited violence. The group is organizing a rally and urging a boycott.

title: ‘Why should anyone bother to play Ranji?’ Tharoor questions Sarfaraz's omission
content: Senior cricketers and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor are voicing strong criticism over India's selection policies, deeming Sarfaraz Khan's omission an "outrage."  Players like Ajinkya Rahane and Karun Nair are frustrated by what they call "age-based selection," arguing domestic performance is being undervalued against IPL scouting and youth potential. This reignites the debate on domestic cricket's relevance.

title: BJP neta arrested for crushing farmer to death, harassing his family
content: BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar has been arrested as the main accused in the murder of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad. Dhakad was attacked by armed men and run over by a vehicle following a land dispute. Nagar is also accused of molesting the victim's daughter during the incident.

title: Heartwarming! Surya's mother prays for Shreyas' recovery on Chhath Puja
content: Cricketer Shreyas Iyer sustained a severe abdominal injury during a match in Sydney. The injury caused internal bleeding, necessitating intensive care. He is now stable and recovering well. His teammate Suryakumar Yadav's mother was seen praying for his speedy recovery. Iyer had shown good form before the incident.

title: Donald Trump’s granddaughter Kai Trump stuns in bold LPGA Tour debut in Florida
content: Donald Trump's granddaughter, 18-year-old Kai Trump, is making her professional golf debut at The Annika, an elite LPGA Tour event. Earning a sponsor's exemption, she will compete alongside top golfers, fulfilling a lifelong dream. The LPGA sees her participation as a way to attract younger audiences and boost the sport's visibility.

title: Rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS races past earth on 29 October 2025
content: Earth is set to host a rare visitor, interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, on October 29, 2025. Discovered in July 2025, this celestial object, originating from beyond our solar system, will pass by at a safe distance of 1.8 AU. Scientists are eager to study its ancient composition, offering insights into planetary formation elsewhere in the galaxy.

title: Netanyahu strikes Gaza: Trump maintains ‘nothing would jeopardise ceasefire’
content: US President Trump stated the Gaza ceasefire would not be jeopardized despite Israel retaliating after Hamas attacked soldiers, though Gaza's civil defense reported 30 deaths from Israeli strikes. Tensions rose over a dispute regarding the return of hostage remains, with Hamas delaying a handover and Israel accusing them of staging the discovery.

title: 'Sky Stadium' in Saudi Arabia: Football venue 350m above ground - Fake or real?
content: Saudi Arabia is reportedly planning a 'sky stadium' 350 meters high for the 2034 FIFA World Cup, integrated into NEOM's futuristic city, The Line.  While viral images circulate, official designs are unconfirmed.  This ambitious project, aiming for solar and wind power, is part of a larger plan for 15 new stadiums, with FIFA reportedly giving preliminary endorsement.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang claims responsibility for attack on Punjabi singer Channi Nattan's house in Canada
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang has claimed responsibility for a house firing incident targeting Punjabi singer Channi Nattan.  A gang member stated the attack was due to Nattan's association with singer Saradar Khera, warning others against similar ties.  Canadian authorities are investigating the claims and forensic evidence.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury latest: How and why docs rushed him to hospital
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer suffered a life-threatening spleen laceration and internal bleeding during a third ODI against Australia in Sydney. Swift medical intervention at St. Vincent's Hospital in Sydney arrested the bleeding without surgery. Iyer is now stable and recovering well, with teammates and the BCCI confirming his improving condition.

title: Massive layoffs in Amazon, UPS, Target: Hiring in limbo; pivot to reinvention
content: The global job market stands at a precarious crossroads as mass layoffs sweep across industries from tech to transport. Giants like Amazon, UPS, and Microsoft have announced sweeping job cuts, citing automation, tariffs, and restructuring pressures. Amid Trump-era federal downsizing and an ongoing shutdown, workers are urged to adapt—through upskilling, resilience, and redefining what work truly means.

title: Honda 0 Alpha revealed: Electric SUV to rival Tata Curvv EV, Maruti e Vitara
content: The rear continues this theme with a distinctive U-shaped lighting signature that merges the tail, reverse, and turn signal lamps. The near-vertical tailgate design also hints at generous luggage capacity and improved practicality. The interior of the EV SUV concept has not been revealed; however, Honda says that the cabin of the Honda 0 Alpha has been designed to feel thin yet roomy.

title: Mahhi Vij shuts down divorce rumours with Jay Bhanushali after 14 years of marriage; says, “False narratives”
content: Mahhi Vij has strongly refuted divorce rumors with Jay Bhanushali, labeling the reports as "false narratives" and threatening legal action. An Instagram post had claimed the couple was heading for divorce after 14 years of marriage, with divorce papers allegedly finalized and child custody decided.

title: Stroke doesn’t discriminate: Doctors share warning signs; why women are at unique risk
content: Stroke can affect anyone, anytime. Recognizing warning signs like FAST is vital. Early detection and prompt medical help save lives and prevent damage. Healthy habits such as exercise, good diet, and managing blood pressure are key to prevention. Awareness and quick action are paramount for protecting yourself and loved ones from stroke.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold & silver prices continue to fall? Here's the outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are expected to continue their decline in the near term, according to Maneesh Sharma. Both metals have fallen from record highs due to profit-booking, easing trade tensions, and a normalization in the silver market. Investors are now awaiting the Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision and comments from its chair.

title: Cognitive confusion: Trump refers to dementia screening as 'very hard' IQ test
content: President Trump claimed to have aced a "very hard" IQ test at Walter Reed, challenging political opponents. However, experts confirm the exam was the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), a tool for detecting early cognitive decline, not an intelligence test. This misrepresentation raises concerns about health communication and political messaging.

title: Israel launches ‘powerful strikes’ on Gaza; over 30 killed
content: Fresh Israeli airstrikes in Gaza have killed at least 30 people and wounded dozens, despite an ongoing US-brokered ceasefire. The Israeli military stated the strikes were a response to Hamas attacking its troops, a claim Hamas denies. The renewed violence strains the ceasefire amid disputes over the return of hostage remains.

title: Bihar Assembly polls: BJP running government through remote control using Nitish's face, alleges Rahul
content: Rahul Gandhi lambasted the ruling BJP at the Centre for being "against social justice" and pointed out that it was at the opposition party’s insistence that the Narendra Modi government agreed to a caste census

title: Swiss firms, research institutions have shown interest in Karnataka’s Quantum City development: Minister N.S. Boseraju
content: Discussions concerning the City’s development were held with representatives from leading global Quantum research institutions, including ETH Zurich and CERN, said the Minister

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Lalu wants to make his son Bihar CM, Sonia her son PM but both posts not vacant: Shah
content: Amit Shah termed the Mahagatbandhan as 'thug bandhan', alleging that Lalu Prasad is involved in fodder, bitumen and land-for-jobs scams, while Congress was involved in corruption cases worth ₹12 lakh crore

title: People of Vizianagaram, Srikakulam heave a sigh of relief with little impact of Cyclone Montha
content: Senior officials had monitored the cyclonic storm from control rooms set up in both Collectors’ offices. There are no human casualties due to heavy rains in any part of Vizianagaram district, says Officials

title: CPI says CPI(M) agrees to ‘freeze’ controversial PM-SHRI MoU with Centre
content: CPI State Secretary Binoy Viswam told The Hindu that the political ground for the party’s four Ministers abstaining from Wednesday’s cabinet had ceased to exist

title: Implement Indian Knowledge System, NEP 2020 earnestly: Maharashtra Governor Acharya Devvrat tells varsities
content: Further, Governor Acharya Devvrat has asked the universities to submit quarterly reports. Expert slams the move as regressive and impractical, calling it the RSS agenda

title: Watch: Where do India-Afghanistan ties stand under Taliban rule?
content: What is the situation inside Afghanistan? We are joined by Dr. Nilofar Sakhi, a faculty member at the Elliott School of International Affairs at George Washington University. She is also the president of the Andiana Foundation, a US-based think tank, and a nonresident senior fellow at the Atlantic Council.

title: Ladakh violence: SC allows Wangchuk’s wife to raise additional grounds in giving reasons against his detention
content: A Bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and N.V. Anajaria has given Ms. Angmo, represented by senior advocates Kapil Sibal, Vivek Tankha and advocate Sarvam Ritam Khare a week to file the amended petition

title: Increase in Tamil Nadu’s elephant population heartening, says Madras High Court Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava says, the increase in the population of the gentle giants from 3,063 in 2024 to 3,170 in 2025 amounts to significant growth

title: Controversy erupts over colour change at Kerala’s JN stadium renovation
content: When contacted by The Hindu, GCDA chairperson K. Chandran Pillai said the colour change had been discussed beforehand and was permitted for improved aesthetics

title: Trump praises PM Modi as ‘tough’ leader, says going to have trade deal with India
content: The U.S. President asserted that his intervention helped de-escalate tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations, claiming that seven planes were shot down during the conflict

title: 23rd round of India-China Corps Commander-level meeting held at Chushul-Moldo
content: This was the first interaction under the General-level mechanism in the western sector since the 24th round of Special Representatives’ talks on August 19, 2025, says Ministry of External Affairs

title: Father, son, and the spectre of ‘jungle raj’
content: At 77 and battling persistent health issues, Mr. Lalu is no longer at the centre of active politics, but he remains the party’s mascot, one who keeps both the RJD afloat and weighs it down in equal measure

title: ‘No wonder his good friend in New Delhi does not want to hug him’: Congress dig at PM Modi after Trump repeats India-Pakistan ceasefire claim
content: "So far, he has said it 54 times. He has said it in the U.S., Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and the United Kingdom... Now President Trump has repeated it, while addressing business leaders in Japan last evening," says Jairam Ramesh

title: Kerala hijab row: Student joins new school
content: The student’s father P.M. Anas said she started attending classes at the Dawn Public School in Palluruthy affiliated with the CBSE

title: Rajnath Singh likely to meet U.S. Defence Secretary on ADMM-Plus sidelines in Malaysia
content: Mr. Singh will address the ADMM-Plus forum on the theme “Reflection on 15 Years of ADMM-Plus and Charting the Way Forward” on November 1

title: CPI(M), CPI race to avoid a confrontation over the “surreptitious” signing of NEP-linked PM-SHRI scheme
content: CPI Minister G R Anil says that grounds for optimism had emerged, and an immediate resolution of the disputation appeared to be in the offing.

title: WaveX, Hyderabad’s T-Hub form alliance to strengthen India’s creative, content and media-tech startups
content: Under the MoU, they will set up 10 incubation centres across India that will serve as hubs of innovation for startups and creators in the AVGC XR space

title: IWAI to invest ₹150 crore for strengthening inland waterways in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Government of Andhra Pradesh will allocate land for the establishment of onshore facilities for the VTMS and river cruise tourism

title: IISc professor Arpita Patra summits highest volcanic peaks of four continents
content: On October 24, Ms. Patra successfully climbed Pico de Orizaba in Mexico the highest volcanic peak in North America

title: Village chief in Manipur's Churachandpur district dies after assault by armed men
content: “The reason behind the assault was not known, but rebels of the United Kuki National Army was suspected to be behind the assault,” police said

title: Tai Ahoms, demanding ST status, stage torch rally in Assam
content: This follows similar rallies by Adivasi, Matak, and Moran communities in the eastern part of the State

title: President Murmu takes sortie in Rafale fighter jet in Haryana’s Ambala
content: The President was also accorded a ceremonial guard of honour after she arrived at the Air Force Station this morning

title: Hyderabad Traffic October 29 | Vehicular congestion on several stretches; staggered logins and early logouts advised for Cyberabad companies
content: In an early morning advisory by the Business Resilience Command and Control (BRCC) of the Society for Cyberabad Security Council (SCSC), officials advised companies to allow flexible timings and avoid non-essential travel during morning hours

title: Cyclone Montha: Temporary road repairs need ₹100 crore, permanent measures nearly ₹900 crore, says Minister Janardhan Reddy
content: Roads were cut off at 21 locations, and repairs were done at six locations; culverts were damaged at 144 locations and 36 have been restored

title: Playback singer and Carnatic vocalist Abhirami Ajai’s wide repertoire bridges classical rigour and modern sensibilities
content: The singer explores the rich world of Carnatic music through curated concerts that weave together compositions by Bhakti saints from across India

title: Cyclone Montha brings rainy morning to Hyderabad on October 29, IMD forecasts light to moderate rain
content: According to data from Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), as of 9 a.m., BHEL recorded a rainfall of 6 mm followed by 5.8 mm in Rajendranagar, 5 mm in Golconda, 4.8 mm in Shaikpet, 4 mm in Khajaguda, 3.8 mm in University of Hyderabad, 3.5 mm in Madhapur, 3 mm in Bowenpally and 2.5 mm in Begumpet.

title: Cyclonic storm to weaken into deep depression before noon
content: The storm is likely to move northwestwards across coastal Andhra Pradesh and maintain its intensity of cyclonic storm during the next 6 hours and weaken further into a deep depression during the subsequent 6 hours, the IMD bulletin of 7 a.m. said.

title: Delhi Police arrest man for espionage, links to foreign scientist and fake passport racket
content: The accused, identified as Mohammad Adil Hussaini and also known by the names Syed Adil Hussain, Nasimuddin and Syed Adil Hussaini, was apprehended from Seemapuri in Delhi two days ago, who was allegedly associated with a foreign nuclear scientist based abroad.

title: Cyclone Montha landfall: Narsapuram coast heaves a sigh of relief, no loss of life
content: No deaths have been reported; 268 trees have collapsed, and eight houses were damaged along the Narsapuram coast

title: Masked shooters target Congress leader's office in Chhattisgarh; 2 kin injured
content: The incident took place at around 6 p.m. on Tuesday (October 28) in Masturi town when local Janpad vice-president Nitesh Singh of the Congress was in his office

title: Maharashtra cabinet approves vision document ‘Developed Maharashtra 2047’
content: According to the CMO, the statewide survey campaign was conducted under the Information and Public Relations Department to get the opinions, expectations, feedback, aspirations and priorities of the citizens on the “Developed Maharashtra-2047” plan.

title: The politics of the EBCs in Bihar
content: As Bihar gears up for the 2025 Assembly Elections, the marginalisation of Extremely Backward Castes in the political landscape is becoming increasingly apparent, highlighting the challenges they face in mobilising a coalition among their 112 recognised castes

title: Poll-bound Bihar ranks last in most social and economic indicators
content: In terms of the Human Development Index, Bihar ranked last among the 27 States which had relevant data in 2022

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: BJP running govt through remote control using Nitish's face, says Rahul
content: Amit Shah said that Lalu Prasad wants to make his son Tejashwi Yadav the Chief Minister of Bihar and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi her son Rahul Gandhi the PM, but both posts were not vacant

title: Memories of the mid-1960s rice shortage in Tamil Nadu
content: The Hindu, in a news report on October 7, 1964, stated: “Thanjavur district, the ‘rice bowl’ of the Madras State [which was how the State was called then], has been experiencing very great difficulty for the last six weeks in meeting the local demands for rice and daily one can see long queues in every town and village in the district waiting for hours to get their daily quota.”

title: Advance compensation for rain-affected Kuruvai paddy farmers, T.N. Agri Minister urges insurance companies
content: According to a press release, the Minister chaired a review meeting at the Secretariat with officials and representatives from insurance companies.

title: When over 50 people perished in a bizarre fire on the Madras-Bangalore Highway
content: Within minutes, flames consumed at least 49 people, including women and children. It took two hours for eight fire tenders, from Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur, and Madras to put out the blaze

title: Foreign Minister of Cyprus to visit India
content: Official sources here highlighted that Cyprus has been one of the “most consistent” supporters of India on the Kashmir issue

title: CM Stalin asks Union Minister to ensure fertiliser supply
content: It is expected that the Samba paddy area will increase, in addition to cultivation of other crops like maize, blackgram, greengram, groundnut, and sugarcane, Mr. Stalin said

title: TNCDW offers mental health training for women SHGs
content: The TNCDW has been providing training to over 3.31 lakh women and students in about 16,500 schools and over 1,600 colleges.

title: SC orders NHRC to monitor Mental Health Authorities across the country
content: A petition had highlighted the plight of mentally-ill prisoners who were found chained at a “faith-based” asylum at Badayun in Uttar Pradesh

title: Why can't Bihar have Muslim CM, asks Owaisi
content: The Hyderabad MP lambasted the ruling NDA as well as the opposition INDIA bloc for allegedly "giving a raw deal" to the Muslim community

title: By declaring Tejashwi as CM face, INDIA bloc gave up little chance it had: Chirag
content: Mr. Paswan said the move has taken away even "a sliver of a chance" the opposition alliance had in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

title: Women indispensable for sustainable peace, says P. Wilson at UN Peacebuilding Commission
content: Mr. Wilson said India has shown through the deployment of women as peacekeepers that they can build trust in communities and “give hope to vulnerable populations”

title: A.P. is fully prepared for cyclone impact, says Minister Lokesh
content: The entire government machinery is functioning with 99% real-time accuracy in data and response to Cyclone Montha, he says

title: Trade talks with EU reduced ‘outstanding issues’, says Goyal
content: Foundation laid for balanced and robust agreement, says Minister after meeting with counterpart; high-level EU team to visit India next week

title: SIR is a BJP plot to select voters, says TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee
content: The Trinamool Congress general secretary asked why the SIR was being carried out only in West Bengal, and not in any State bordering Bangladesh and Myanmar

title: Missing minor girl killed in road accident
content: A 16-year-old girl who was reported missing after not returning from school in Bannerghatta, was later killed in a road accident on Hosakote Road

title: CM stresses round-the-clock monitoring as Cyclone Montha nears A.P. coast
content: Wind and rainfall intensity should be forecast in advance for a timely response, says Naidu, adding speed and efficiency must be ensured in relief and rehabilitation measures

title: Experts blame warmer sea for increasing frequency of tropical cyclones over Bay of Bengal
content: Since 2010, Andhra Pradesh has borne the brunt of at least 10 major tropical cyclones, some of them categorised as severe and very severe cyclonic storms

title: Watch: Challenges faced by paddy farmers in Tamil Nadu
content: The Cauvery delta in central Tamil Nadu, regarded as the rice bowl of south India, is in the news, though for all the wrong reasons

title: Main carriageway of PRR to be less than 100 ft; not enough, say experts
content: Of the 100 metres, Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) will now “commercially develop” a total of 35 metres to cross-subsidise the project.

title: As SIR expands, questions on Election Commission’s power to conduct exercise, verify citizenship still pending in Supreme Court
content: Petitioners challenging the Bihar SIR claim it violated voters rights, broke voting laws, wrongly requires existing voters to prove citizenship; Election Commission cites plenary powers granted under Article 324

title: Cyclone Montha crosses A.P. coast near Narsapur, heavy rain damages 43,000 hectares of crops
content: 83,000 farmers affected in Andhra Pradesh, power sector incurs loss of ₹2,200 crore with damage to infrastructure; 35,000 people evacuated

title: Will Vikassheel Insaan Party chief Mukesh Sahani enthuse EBCs to vote for the Mahagatbandhan?
content: The Mallah voters continue to remain divided between the NDA and the Mahagatbandhan; despite being in politics for 10 years, Mukesh Sahani is not very relatable to the people from his caste

title: Security breach ahead of Vice-President’s visit to Town Hall in Coimbatore
content: Commotion prevailed as the incident took place at 2.30 p.m. when the motorcade of the Vice-President was scheduled to leave for the venue from Circuit House, around 1 km away

title: CPI resolute in its stance on PM SHRI; CPI(M) to assuage hurt sentiments
content: CPI(M) is contemplating ways to restore the thaw in its relations with CPI in view of the upcoming local body elections.  The former may try to cool tempers by explaining the reasons for hurriedly joining the scheme. A meeting of LDF will be convened soon to give an explanation to the allies

title: Congress questions Centre’s plan to place Agniveers in private security firms
content: The party accuses government of betraying its promise to provide pensionable jobs to Agniveers in government services

title: Cyclone Montha: incessant rain wreaks havoc in Nellore, Prakasam districts
content: People from both the districts, particularly the daily wage labourers, face severe problems; continuous rains in the catchment areas and steady inflows from upstream led to rising water levels in Penna river and Somasila Reservoir in Nellore district

title: Opposition parties in West Bengal raise concern over ‘hurried’ SIR process
content: Opposition and regional parties warn marginalised voters, orphans and those who lost documents in floods, risk being excluded

title: MLA smells corruption in Speaker’s office, seeks HC judge-monitored probe into purchases of all materials
content: Speaker U.T. Khader denies corruption in his office. All materials were purchased legally with due approval from the Finance Department, he says

title: AICC issues ultimatum to KPCC to end factionalism and begin local body campaign
content: AICC summoned State leadership to Delhi for marathon closed-door discussions and one-to-ones with the national leadership

title: Jays, 'team of uncommon men,' rebound to tie WS
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a two-run homer off Shohei Ohtani, and the Blue Jays shook off their epic 18-inning loss to even the World Series with a 6-2 victory over the Dodgers in Game 4 on Tuesday night.

title: Patriots deal White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: Ohtani rues 'regrettable' inning, takes Game 4 loss
content: A day after an 18-inning victory for the Dodgers in Game 3, Los Angeles star Shohei Ohtani took the mound in Game 4, wound up with the loss, and finished hitless in the batter's box, as the Toronto Blue Jays evened the World Series at 2-2 with a 6-2 win.

title: Giannis savors beating Knicks after season sweep
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo acknowledged Tuesday's 121-111 victory over the Knicks carried some extra significance, but only because New York swept the Bucks in last season's series.

title: Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: Heat's Rozier faced $8M tax lien from IRS in '23
content: Heat guard Terry Rozier, who was placed on leave amid allegations he manipulated his performance in a March 2023 NBA game as part of gambling schemes, was facing an $8 million tax lien from the IRS in November 2023.

title: LSU interim living in moment despite 'dream' job
content: Interim LSU coach Frank Wilson called his promotion "something you would dream of" but eschewed the opportunity discuss his prospects for retaining the job beyond the rest of this season.

title: Dad: Aspinall 'can't see anything' out of right eye
content: The father of Tom Aspinall said the UFC heavyweight champion "can't see anything" out of his right eye days after the disastrous eye poke he suffered against Ciryl Gane at UFC 321.

title: 💪 Latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 9. Plus, we picked the best offseason signing, hiring or draft pick for each roster.

title: Solak: Why Drake Maye should be MVP, a defense of Caleb Williams, four trades that must happen
content: Here are four takes off the first eight weeks of the season, four trade proposals that make a ton of sense and some wild Week 8 trends to watch.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: Does Notre Dame need to run the table? We try to make sense of the constantly evolving playoff picture conference by conference.

title: Carousel chaos meets Lane Kiffin, and what he does next will be interesting
content: More than $150M in buyouts and multiple job openings mean Lane Kiffin is the center of the CFB universe.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: Why the Saints are turning to QB Tyler Shough now
content: After benching Spencer Rattler during their Week 8 loss, the Saints will start their second-round pick Sunday.

title: Five reasons Brian Kelly failed at LSU
content: Kelly's departure could be pinned on trouble with his staff, trouble fitting in or a mad scramble for Lane Kiffin.

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ranking of No. 1 seeds shifts in final preseason edition
content: A key injury to South Carolina and other developments in the final weeks to tipoff shift projections.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: Arne Slot's biggest test yet as Liverpool head coach: Ending this mini-crisis
content: After the dizzying highs of a league title, Liverpool's slump this term under Arne Slot has become a crisis. Can the mercurial Dutch manager turn things around?

title: It might get worse for Juventus before it gets better
content: The problems plaguing Juventus, which led to the firing of coach Igor Tudor, have been years in the making.

title: Powerhouses Spain, Germany set up mouthwatering Nations League final
content: Reigning world champions Spain will take on perennial European powerhouse Germany to decide the winner of the UEFA Women's Nations League.

title: Agyemang injury worry, Lionesses return to form, Matildas outclassed
content: The Lionesses rediscovered their top gear but might have suffered a major blow, while the Matildas must flip the script in this burgeoning rivalry.

title: Trade value index: Trust in Drake Maye, Harold Fannin Jr.
content: With less than a month to the fantasy trade deadline, the rest-of-season rankings help identify worthy targets.

title: Experts' rankings for Week 9
content: Individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, plus Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Wardley moves up at heavyweight after KO of Parker
content: Fabio Wardley is the new WBO interim heavyweight champion and moves up five spots. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: LA Knight's loss, JD McDonagh's win both carry weight
content: When wins and losses matter in WWE, a thrilling women's tag team championship and more to remember from "Raw."

title: College football futures: Is now the time to bet on Marcel Reed and Texas A&M?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado breaks down what to know.

title: Why all 16 playoff teams will (and won't) win MLS Cup
content: Look at the MLS playoff field long enough and you can make a case that all 16 teams have what it takes to be contenders -- or that they're pretenders.

title: Bearman's Mexico performance shows Ferrari there's life after Hamilton, Leclerc
content: It's been a season to forget at Ferrari, but academy driver Oliver Bearman is showing promise at Haas, culminating in a fourth-place finish in Mexico.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius Júnior eyes Real Madrid exit in January
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior could seek an exit in the January transfer window. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Cloud Seeding In Delhi Soon: Where It Worked, Where It Failed
content: Cloud seeding has been tried in various countries around the world, but its success has varied from place to place.

title: Kolkata Woman Molested At 5-Star Hotel By Park Street Gang Rape Convict
content: A woman was allegedly sexually harassed and attacked with glass bottles by a group of men at a five-star hotel in Kolkata, police said.

title: President Murmu Flies In Rafale Fighter From Airbase Key To Op Sindoor
content: President Droupadi Murmu has taken off from the Ambala Air Force Base in Haryana for a sortie in a Rafale fighter jet that recently made its war debut.

title: Ahead Of IPO, Lenskart CEO Says Valuation Is For Investors, Not Entrepreneurs
content: Lenskart founder and CEO Peyush Bansal has brushed aside concerns over the eyewear brand's lofty valuation ahead of its upcoming initial public offering (IPO). The entrepreneur said his job was to serve customers, not to set market prices.

title: Pune Techie Arrested Over Terror Links Had Saved Osama Bin Laden's Speeches
content: A software engineer, who was arrested by the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad in Pune earlier this week over alleged links with Al-Qaeda, allegedly followed terror outfit's founder Osama Bin Laden's speeches.

title: "It's Too Bad": Trump Says He Is Not Allowed To Run For A Third Term
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that "it's too bad" he's not allowed to run for a third term, conceding the constitutional reality even as he expressed interest in continuing to serve.

title: Why Cyclone Melissa Is A Beast Among Monster Atlantic Storms
content: Hurricane Melissa, which struck Jamaica with record-tying 185 mph winds Tuesday, was a beast that stood out as extreme even in a record number of monster storms spawned over the last decade in a superheated Atlantic Ocean.

title: "Want To Die With Dignity": Woman, 30, Leads Mexico's Fight For Euthanasia
content: Samara Martinez, a young Mexican woman who is sick and dying, smiles as she asks her many TikTok followers a difficult question.

title: Bhupesh Baghel's Son Denied Bail As Liquor Scam Probe At Crucial Stage
content: Former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's son Chaitanya Baghel has been denied bail in the state's alleged multi-crore liquor scam.

title: Bangladeshi Man Chants Religious Slogans At Bengaluru Temple, Attacks Idols
content: A Bangladeshi national, who was allegedly illegally residing in Bengaluru, was arrested for trying to raise religious slogans inside a temple, triggering tension in the area.

title: 22 Children Among 50 Killed In Latest Israeli Strikes, Says Gaza Agency
content: Gaza's civil defence agency told AFP Wednesday dozens of Israeli strikes overnight killed at least 50 people in the Palestinian territory, hours after US President Donald Trump said "nothing" would jeopardise the ceasefire agreement he helped broker.

title: Fact Check: President Murmu's Deepfake Blames PM Modi For Rafale Flight
content: PIB Fact Check flagged a digitally-altered video of President Droupadi Murmu that is being circulated by Pakistani propaganda accounts with false claims alleging that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is using her as a prop to promote Rafale fighter jets.

title: Some Amazon Employees Were Laid Off With Early-Morning Messages: Report
content: Thousands of Amazon employees woke up early Tuesday morning to find text messages informing them that they had been fired from their jobs.

title: Cyclone Montha Impact: Landslide Hits Andhra's Srisailam Temple
content: The impact of Cyclone Montha has caused severe disruption and damage at the renowned Srisailam Mahakshetra, a sacred pilgrimage site in Andhra Pradesh. But a potential major tragedy was narrowly averted thanks to the late-night timing of the landslid

title: Bike Taxi Driver Sexually Assaults Woman In Chennai, Then Drops Her Home
content: A man working as a bike taxi driver in Chennai was arrested by the police for sexually assaulting a 22-year-old woman on Monday.

title: "Are You Narayana Murthy?" Runable CEO Slammed For 80-Hour Workweek Post
content: The position was on-site in Bengaluru, and candidates should be willing to work six days a week, putting in 60 to 80 hours if needed.

title: Masood Azhar's 'Paradise' Promise And 'Men' Warning To Jaish Women Recruits
content: Enemies of Jaish-e-Mohammed have put "Hindu women into the Army", and the terror outfit's new women brigade, Jamaat ul-Mominaat, aims to counter this move, Jaish chief Masood Azhar has said

title: Bangladesh National Anthem Sung At Congress Event. Why It's Not A Problem
content: The BJP unit in Assam has slammed the Congress over a video of a district-level leader singing Amar Sonar Bangla, Bangladesh's national anthem, at a party event in Sribhumi district

title: Outrage After Accused Sikh Truck Driver Appears In US Court Without Turban
content: A 21-year-old Indian truck driver, accused of causing a fatal crash in California, appeared in a US court without his turban, leading to outrage among Sikhs.

title: Questions about UConn's repeat chances, Stanford's comeback, more
content: the UConn Huskies won their fourth consecutive NCAA women's basketball title (11th overall) in 2016 . last season, they dominated Final Four foes UCLA and South Carolina . the team is ranked no. 1 in the preseason poll despite losing standout Paige Bueckers .

title: New UFC champion Mackenzie Dern moves up in strawweight top 10
content: Virna Jandiroba won the women's strawweight title on tuesday . the 115-pound heavyweight vacated by Zhang weili . dern moves up four spots to no. 2, right behind Zhang . he remains no. 2 after his split-decision win over Jailton Almeida .

title: Takeaways: Blue Jays tie series with huge Game 4 win
content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the los Angeles Dodgers 6-2 in game 4 to tie the series 2-2 . a two-run shot gave his team the lead in the third inning . the series goes back to Toronto for game 6 .

title: United Center's mozzarella pucks lead latest NHL, NBA arena food
content: The 2025-26 NBA and NHL seasons are underway, which means fans are filing into arenas again and concession stands will be getting creative to serve the masses. Among those creations are the crispy mozzarella pucks that will be sold only at  Chicago Blackhawks ' games at the United Center. The parmesan herb-breaded mozzarella sticks -- or in this case pucks -- are sold with homemade marinara sauce. Here are some other innovations that can be found at NBA and NHL arenas across the campaigns.

title: 'When we were at our lowest, the man didn't blink': What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit
